title: Print, "Ceiling design, hunting trophies", 1740
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description:
Upper left (presumed central ceiling motif), a symmetrical design with medallion at center, a putti holding a standard (upper left), a seated putti (upper right). Putti are repeated below. Decoration includes pine trees, garlands, S and C scrolls. Below at right angle, motifs of hunting trophies: birds, arrows, banners, a hunting horn, hounds, foxes, squirrel, an owl, placed among horns, pine trees, arabesques and a corner cartouche with animal head in the center and a hunting goddess at top. Sections are connected with dotted lines, presumably as a guide for the stuccodor. 

Inscriptions: 
Cum Privil. S.C. Maj.
F. de Cuvilliés In. etdel.
F. X. Jungwierth. SC. Mon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Ceiling design, hunting trophies", 1740.
1740. Engraving on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-282-13.
